content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Calculate the estimated time to sunburn for different skin types when exposed to the sun at 1:00 pm with SPF 1 in Brazil.  Please interact with https://www.wolframalpha.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I need to enter the query regarding estimated sunburn time for different skin types at 1:00 pm in Brazil with SPF 1 into the search input field to get the answer from WolframAlpha.
Action: Type [6]; estimated time to sunburn for different skin types at 1:00 pm in Brazil with SPF 1
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.2
token: : Type [6]; estimated time to sunburn for different skin types at 1:00 pm in Brazil with SPF

content: Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The query has been correctly entered in the search box, and WolframAlpha has started interpreting the question. I need to wait for the computational results to load completely.
Action: Wait
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The computational results section is starting to load, but the results are not yet visible. I need to scroll down to view the full output and find the information required for the sunburn times.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.4
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current settings are incorrect; the inputs show "Toronto, Ontario, Canada" instead of Brazil, and the start time is not 1:00 pm. I need to update the location and the start time to match the task requirements (location: Brazil, time: 1:00 pm), and ensure SPF is set to 1.
Action: Type [1]; Brazil
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The page has returned to the main input view, likely due to the earlier manual text input. I need to re-enter the required information into the computational input fields on the next screen (location: Brazil, time: 1:00 pm, SPF 1). I should trigger another computation to proceed.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The location is correctly set to Brazil. The start time, however, is set to 12:14 pm UTC-3, not 1:00 pm. I need to change the start time in the corresponding input box to 1:00 pm to match the task requirements.
Action: Type [2]; 1:00 pm
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screen has returned to the main WolframAlpha input field, likely after editing the previous inputs. To continue, I should re-scroll to the computational input fields where I can specify the start time (1:00 pm), location, and SPF. This is necessary because the task isn't complete yet.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The start time has now been set to 1:00 pm, location is Brazil, and skin type is "all." However, there is currently no explicit SPF value entered. I need to include SPF 1 (sun protection factor) to match the task requirements before clicking compute.
Action: Type [4]; 1
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I attempted to input the SPF value in the previous screen, but the current view has returned to the main input field, likely due to an invalid target for typing the value. I need to go back to the computational input fields to edit/add the SPF (preferably by scrolling down or re-triggering the computation).
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The SPF value has been entered as "time in sun," which is incorrect. The box labeled "sun protection factor (SPF)" (likely the next input after 4, but not visible here), should contain the value 1. The SPF value should be placed there to get the correct computation.
Action: Type [6]; 1
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.75
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The SPF value wasn't entered because the previous action targeted a span, not a textbox. I need to scroll down again to find a visible and interactable input textbox for the SPF value, then enter "1" there.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.75
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The SPF input field is still missing; there are three input boxes (likely skin type, location, and start time), none labeled for SPF. The correct field for SPF may be dynamically added or needs to be activated after reviewing instructions or clicking a certain element. The time in sun is already set, as is the rest, so next logical step is to try the "Compute" button to see if results are generated based on current inputs (including time in sun = 1 hour, which may serve as a reference for sunburn time scaling with SPF 1).
Action: Click [6]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.8
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The page has reset to the main search input; it's necessary to scroll down again to reach the computational inputs where specific values (skin type, location, time, and SPF) can be set, to finally obtain the result.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.8
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: There are three input boxes labeled [2], [3], and [4]. The SPF should correspond to the last parameter (the one under "Also include: sun protection factor (SPF)"), which appears to be input [4]. I need to type "1" into this box to set the SPF to 1 as required.
Action: Type [4]; 1
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.85
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The view has returned to the main input screen, suggesting that the previous value input triggered a reload or reset. To reach the SPF and other computational input fields again, I need to scroll down.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.85
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The SPF field is available, and the correct box is input [4] (the last input in the form)—it is currently empty. I need to enter "1" here to fulfill the requirement for sun protection factor (SPF) 1, so the computation will reflect the correct scenario.
Action: Type [4]; 1
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.9
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The page has returned to the main input field screen, showing the WolframAlpha search bar. To continue with the calculation after adding all parameters (including SPF = 1), I need to scroll down to the computational input fields again.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.9

Observation: please analyze the attached screenshot and give the Thought and Action. I've provided the tag name of each element and the text it contains (if text exists). Note that <textarea> or <input> may be textbox, but not exactly. Please focus more on the screenshot and then refer to the textual information.
[0]: <button> "time to sunburn";	[1]: <button> "all";	[2]: <input> "";	[3]: <input> "";	[4]: <input> "";	[5]: "sun protection factor (SPF)";	[6]: "end time";	[7]: <button> "Compute";	[8]: "UV index";

content:
Thought: All the relevant fields are present. The SPF input field ([4]) is empty, and it is specifically labeled for SPF by the "sun protection factor (SPF)" indicator ([5]). I should enter "1" in this field to reflect the task's requirement of SPF 1 before clicking "Compute."
Action: Type [4]; 1
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.95
